title: Liverpool owner John W Henry under attack from ex-star Jamie Carragher over lack of depth at Anfield
text:

John W Henry has come under fire from Liverpool fans after the club failed to strengthen in the January transfer market. 
The Reds owner excitedly tweeted about the Super Bowl on Sunday night, only to be greeted with a chorus of disapproval from Reds fans more concerned with the dismal defeat at Hull. 
“We don’t care John, just give us some money” was the general tone of the response, a theme that was picked up too by some influential former players like Jamie Carragher and Didi Hamann, who are disappointed about the lack of recruitment in January. 
For Sky TV pundit Carragher said the problem is that Liverpool didn’t have enough strength in depth to withstand the rigours of an incessant, game every three days winter programme. The Reds owner was very excited by the Super Bowl (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Liverpool keen to beat Man United to teenage Forest star Ben Brereton 
“A major disappointment, whether it was down to the manager or the board, was not getting any reinforcements in in January,” he said pointedly. “The players are there. I am not saying panic buy. 
“I am talking about in terms of numbers, Liverpool needed something. If you look at their bench, they haven’t got anything like what Manchester United have got, the teams they are trying to compete with. 
“The fact that they haven’t reinforced from a position of strength – where they were in the league as the best challengers for Chelsea – has meant they have fallen away. They don’t have the squad to match the other teams.” Firmino and co. have fallen off the pace in 2017 (Photo: Andrew Powell) 
Hamann went even further, suggesting Liverpool were wrong to give manager Jurgen Klopp a six-year contract in the summer, but pointing the finger at the owners, saying: 
“I don’t think they’ve been smart in the transfer market. If you don’t fancy the left back you need to sign a new left back. The goalkeeper situation, that hasn’t worked. 
“My biggest worry with Liverpool is they are too soft in midfield. I watched them against Chelsea who had two proper holding midfielders in Kante and Matip; in Liverpool I don’t see enough purpose and structure, and this is why they are in the position they are at the moment.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
